listings.bat_location: flat Aquamarine Blue, an
listings.bat_description: This 1986 Porsche 911 Turbo coupe was a commissioned build by Rob Ida in the style of hisSEMA 930. This example was specified in flat Aquamarine Blue, and the suspension, engine, and interior were all modified as part of the build. It is powered by a 3.3-liter turbocharged flat-six linked to a four-speed manual transmission and rides on 15√ó8‚Ä≥ and 16√ó12‚Ä≥ Fuchs-style wheels. The current owner acquired the car in 2021, and in 2024 the rear spoiler was removed, a Garrett intercooler was installed, the interior was redone with Tartan accents, and a custom exhaust system was fabricated. Now showing 123k miles, this modified 911 Turbo is offered on dealer consignment with records, the removed tea tray spoiler, a clean Carfax report, and a Washington title.Ida‚Äôs SEMA build involved fitting custom-fabricated bumpers with air intakes up front and a center-exit exhaust system out back along with a body-color heckblende, and this example was specified in non-metallic Aquamarine. listings.bat_location: Black over black leather, an
listings.bat_description: This 2007 Porsche 911 Carrera S coupe is powered by a 3.8-liter flat-six and was optioned with the X51 Powerkit, which added a revised camshafts, cylinder heads, and engine management system, along with a GT3-style intake manifold, revised exhaust manifolds, a carbon-fiber intake housing, a third radiator, and a valved sport exhaust system. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle, and the car was modified under current ownership with GT3 lower control arms, Tarett Engineering GT3-style sway bars, Tarett Engineering toe links and thrust arm bushings, H&R springs, and a DSC suspension control module. It is finished in Black over black leather, and additional features include the Sport Chrono Package Plus, 19‚Ä≥ Carrera Sport wheels, front sport seats, an AUTO-BLiP throttle module, and an Aerokit-style front bumper cover, front spoiler, and fixed rear wing. The seller purchased the car in May 2017 and has since added approximately 7k of the 50k miles indicated.

listings.bat_description: This 2001 Porsche 911 Turbo is a Canadian-market coupe powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.6L flat-six, which was rebuilt in April 2017 and has been fitted with the Evolution Motorsports GT700 kit along with aftermarket pistons and rods and a Fabspeed exhaust system. Finished in Seal Gray Metallic over Graphite Gray leather upholstery, the car is equipped with a five-speed Tiptronic automatic transaxle, carbon-fiber interior trim, Turbo Aerokit-style body components, aluminum pedals, black-finished 20‚Ä≥ five-spoke alloy wheels, a sunroof, a rear spoiler, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, and a Kenwood stereo. The current owner purchased the car in 2022 and has since added approximately 5k of the 108k kilometers (~67k miles). Exterior details include a Metropol Blue convertible soft top, bi-xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, and a speed-activated rear spoiler. listings.bat_description: This 2004 Porsche 911 GT3 wears a red vinyl wrap with black GT3 graphics and has been fitted with JRZ adjustable coilovers and an FVD Brombacher exhaust system in addition to a vented front bumper, an electric power steering pump, and a CAE shifter. The car is powered by a 3.6-liter Mezger flat-six, while gear changes are through a six-speed manual transaxle linked with a limited-slip differential, both of which were reportedly rebuilt by Autometrics Motorports between 2018 and 2019. It rides on Staggered-width 18‚Ä≥ GT3 wheels and inside, black leather‚Äìtrimmed bucket seats are accompanied by Sabelt multi-point harnesses as well as a Porsche CDR23 stereo. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2025, this 996.2 GT3 has 30k miles and is now offered in Delaware with a Carfax report and a clean Florida title.The 996 GT3 featured revised lower aerodynamic lower bodywork and a fixed rear wing in comparison to the contemporary Carrera.
